central_thesis: This lesson posits that the development of supersensory powers is intrinsically linked to the understanding and mastery of consciousness, particularly superconsciousness and self-consciousness, emphasizing the crucial role of focused attention on the present moment ('here and now') as the foundation for all true spiritual and magical development.

structure_content.chapter_title: Introduction to Supersensory Powers and Consciousness
structure_content.summary: Introduces the concept of superconsciousness as represented by Tarot Key 0, The Fool, and as the underlying essence of all consciousness. It contrasts this with self-consciousness (Tarot Key 1, The Magician) and highlights the importance of understanding consciousness principles to avoid ignorance and karmic entanglements. The text warns against focusing solely on 'psychic' powers without a foundational understanding of consciousness, which can lead to further problems.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Nature of Consciousness and its Aspects
structure_content.summary: Explains that all aspects of consciousness (superconsciousness, subconsciousness, self-consciousness, material/psychic awareness) are manifestations of a single, all-pervading One Consciousness. The separation into 'bits and pieces' is due to limited awareness. A map analogy is used to illustrate how these aspects are representations, not the totality itself. The goal is to understand these powers in relation to their common identity in the One Consciousness.

Defines self-consciousness as the ability to limit awareness, which is essential for evolution. It is compared to a scientist using a microscope to study a microbe in detail. Self-consciousness is presented as God's 'microscope' for examining the minute parts of Itself. This focus allows for the recognition of distinct miracles within the universe, emphasizing that God is not separate from us.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Power of Attention and the 'Here and Now'
structure_content.summary: Identifies self-consciousness as the power of attention, stating that what one attends to is strengthened and built. This is directly linked to the Tarot Key 1, The Magician. The lesson powerfully emphasizes the 'here and now' as the only point of true experience and awareness, the basis for life itself. Inattention to the present leads to a state akin to death. True consciousness and supersensory abilities arise from complete attention to the present moment, which eventually expands to encompass all time.

Concludes by stressing that the first essential step for developing supersensory perceptions and becoming a complete human is practicing seeing and being in the 'here and now.' This focused attention allows for true and perceptive seeing, leading to complete intuition, which is only possible after preliminary steps of present-moment awareness have been taken.

key_concepts.definition: The highest state of consciousness, represented by Tarot Key 0 (The Fool), which is the beginning, the end, and the vital part that permeates all keys and is the essence of all development. It is the unlimited, fundamental consciousness.

The ability to limit awareness, represented by Tarot Key 1 (The Magician). It is described as a 'microscopic awareness of God' for examining minute parts of the universe and is the power of attention. It is a necessary tool for evolution, allowing us to focus and understand specific aspects of the One Consciousness.

The fundamental, all-pervading reality of existence. Superconsciousness, subconsciousness, and self-consciousness are presented as aspects or manifestations of this singular, unified consciousness. The separation of these aspects is due to limited human awareness.

The present moment, considered the only point of true experience, awareness, and life. Mastering attention to the 'here and now' is presented as the foundational practice for developing supersensory powers, intuition, and true consciousness. It is the gateway to the eternal.

The operative power of self-consciousness. What one attends to is strengthened and built, making attention the primary tool for creation and manifestation, whether positive or negative. It is the force that shapes reality through focus.

The text differentiates between 'psychic' powers, which can lead to trouble if pursued without proper foundation, and true 'supersensory powers' which emerge from a developed understanding of consciousness and mastery of the 'here and now.' Psychic perception is warned against if attention is focused on negativity.

practical_system.description: The practical system outlined focuses on cultivating conscious awareness through disciplined attention to the present moment ('here and now'). This is presented not as a mere philosophical concept but as the active mechanism through which spiritual development and supersensory perception are achieved. The core 'practice' involves redirecting and holding one's attention fully on present experiences, resisting the natural tendency to dwell on the past or anticipate the future. This practice is the prerequisite for developing true intuition and any form of advanced consciousness or psychic ability. It implies that all esoteric work, including the study of Tarot keys, is a means to refine this fundamental faculty of attention.
tools: Tarot Keys (specifically Key 0, The Fool, and Key 1, The Magician, as symbolic representations of consciousness states)
Mind/Attention (as the primary tool for practice and manifestation)

relevant_quotes.text: Since consciousness is the root of our knowing, you must understand the principles of consciousness or you will not be capable of understanding anything else. Without proper understanding of consciousness you can remain lost in delusions, illusions, sorrows, and most of all, lost in ignorance.

The methods of learning how to understand the supersensory powers, of learning how to work with these powers in yourself, learning how to recognize their manifestations in yourself and in others; all of these elements mesh together. One of the reasons that many aspirants have so many problems is that their interest has been limited to the 'psychic' field.

Just as you may be a sister, beloved friend, teacher, mother, child, student--all of these relationships--yet you and they are one being; you are all of them, all of these are you; these relationships do not make you different. You are not cut apart or put asunder because of having these different relationships. In the same manner there is only one superconscious awareness or level of life. You and I are each not so much distinct parts or a measurable fraction of the One Self, as we are each a way, a channel of expression for the One Self.

Self-consciousness is our power of attention, and that is what Tarot Key 1 depicts. You know now that what you attend to you strengthen; what you give your attention to you build. If you give your attention to rightness, you strengthen and build rightness. If you give your attention to ugliness, you build disharmony. If you give your attention to sorrow you automatically attract those who will help you to experience all of the sorrow you can possibly endure. If you focus your attention on fear you will very quickly be able to say with Job, 'That which I feared has come upon me!' Your attention is your first great power of creation.

To be attentive to the here and now is life. To be inattentive to the here and now is death. You may have other ideas of what life and death are, but we advise you to accept this premise for the moment, and we will show you how true it is. If you are attentive to the here and now and are aware of what is going on about you, then you are developing ever stronger images, becoming ever more aware of those conditions in your environment that you are creating; you are gaining ever greater knowledge, and from this, you will reap greater wisdom and more discrimination. All the faculties that are required for true consciousness have come to you only by your training yourself to keep your awareness in the here and now, for this is the point of expansion into the eternal NOW. This attentive awareness is the preface to supersensory experience of the most magnificent kind.

The first essential, then, is to practice seeing in the here and now, not only to develop extrasensory perceptions, but to become a complete human. Give your attention to the here and now, and you will be completely astonished how the world will change under your very eyes, ears, and touch. You are now starting to live life instead of letting your attention be sponged off into the images that we mentioned. Only as you start absorbing 'now' into your consciousness, by keeping your attention in the here and now are you going to see truly and perceptively into that which occurs. This principle is the essence of complete intuition. Intuition does not function except when you have taken all of the preliminary steps. The development of intuition in its true sense begins with your ability to keep your attention focused upon the here and now.

critical_analysis.relevance: This text, originating from Ann Davies' teachings, is highly relevant to students of esoteric psychology and practical occultism. It bridges esoteric philosophy (superconsciousness, unity of being) with practical techniques (attention, present moment focus) essential for developing higher awareness and powers. It places a strong emphasis on psychological discipline as the foundation for spiritual development, a common theme in Western Esotericism, particularly within the lineage of figures like G.I. Gurdjieff and P.D. Ouspensky, who also emphasized concentrated awareness and the 'here and now' for spiritual awakening. The use of Tarot keys as symbolic representations for states of consciousness is a hallmark of occult studies.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary audience is students of esotericism, occultism, or metaphysics seeking to develop their consciousness and supersensory abilities. This includes individuals interested in Tarot as a psychological or spiritual tool, those studying advanced metaphysics or consciousness studies, and aspiring practitioners who need a foundational understanding of consciousness before delving into more complex magical practices.
